New Records: Dodgers tied the postseason record of 33 consecutive scoreless innings
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani was 2 for 4 with a walk while scoring two runs and driving in another
Mookie Betts added a three-run double in the eighth
Flaherty left to a standing ovation from the sellout crowd of 53,503
Max Muncy singled up the middle, scoring Betts and a hobbled Freddie Freeman
Ohtani chased Senga with an RBI single in the second
The Dodgers tacked on three runs in the fourth off reliever David Peterson as Tommy Edman and Freeman had RBI singles
Post-Match Reflections: Mookie Betts expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Flaherty allowed two hits over seven innings
The game was played in front of a sellout crowd of 53,503
